get.description:
UI grid/editor metadata for LeaveTypeRules.
- Meta keys are lower-case.
- Field names are PascalCase to match JSON/DTO.

schema.title: Response List Leave Type Rules Api V1 Leave Type Rules  Get

post.description:
- Derive dims from appointment/contact (no AccountId in request)
- Resolve PH dates (best-effort) using Worksite's PH group
- Build adapter request and call preview_accrual_adapt(db, req)
- Enforce strict response contract (fail fast on missing required fields)
- Emit Server-Timing header for perf hygiene

schema.title: Response List Runs Api V1 Accruals Runs Get

post.description:
Writes one LeaveLedger row per input day (append-only).
Idempotent via unique index on IdempotencyKey (and API pattern on SourceRef).
Routing:
  - OPEN period covers date  -> ProcessPeriodId=<matched>,    RoutedReason=Matched
  - future OPEN exists       -> ProcessPeriodId=<next>,       RoutedReason=NextOpenPeriod
  - otherwise                -> ProcessPeriodId=NULL,         RoutedReason=Unassigned

Deterministically recompute BalanceAfterMinutes for the selected window.
- Filters: EmployeeAppointmentId, LeaveTypeId, IsDeleted=0, DateFrom..DateTo
- Order: EffectiveDate ASC, then (as tie-breaker) PostingDate ASC, LeaveLedgerId ASC
- Running total of Minutes; writes BalanceAfterMinutes back.

get.description:
Thin read-side preview of balance impact:

Returns a JSON object like:
    {
        "LeaveRequestId": "...",
        "EmployeeAppointmentId": "...",
        "LeaveTypeId": "...",
        "AsOf": "YYYY-MM-DD",
        "RequiredMinutes": 480,
        "AvailableMinutes": 240,
        "ShortfallMinutes": 240,
        "HasSufficientBalance": false,
        "RequiresBalance": true
    }

post.description:
Legacy approve route.

Canonical contract is via PUT /leave-requests/{id}/status
with Status='APPROVED'. This path is a thin alias that
delegates to the same service entry point (update_status).

Legacy reject route.

Canonical contract is via PUT /leave-requests/{id}/status
with Status='REJECTED'. This path is a thin alias to
ensure a single service code path.

put.description:
Single canonical status route (per 2025-11-11 contract).

Contracts:
- 200: Status transition applied; APPROVED returns a posted envelope.
- 422: Missing IdempotencyKey when moving to SUBMITTED.
- 409: One of:
    * Duplicate IdempotencyKey for SUBMITTED.
    * Illegal status transition per StatusMatrix.
    * Insufficient balance when policy.RequiresBalance is true and
      available minutes < requested minutes. In that case the service raises
      HTTP 409 with a structured detail payload:
          {
              "detail": {
                  "code": "INSUFFICIENT_BALANCE",
                  "message": "...",
                  "leave_request_id": "...",
                  "required_minutes": ...,
                  "available_minutes": ...,
                  "as_of": "YYYY-MM-DD"
              }
          }

409.description: Duplicate IdempotencyKey, illegal transition, or insufficient balance

detail.message: Insufficient leave balance to approve this request.

post.description: Alias route for 'reopen' â€” sets Status='DRAFT'. No IdempotencyKey required.

schema.title: Response Reopen Leave Request Api V1 Leave Requests  Leave Request Id  Reopen Post

get.description:
Ledger rows that were posted from this LeaveRequest.
Returns {"items":[...], "meta":{count, reasons, window, minutesPerDay}}

Valuation journal derived from ledger rows for this LeaveRequest.

For the thin slice, each item includes:
  - ProcessDate
  - Minutes
  - RateTypeCode (stubbed)
  - Method (e.g. "Stub")

schema.title: Response List Templates For Account Api V1 Message Templates By Account  Account Id  Get

post.description:
Authenticate a user by email + password.
Returns a JWT access token if successful.

get.description: Return basic info about the current user based on the JWT.

Name.title: Name
Name.description: Full display name of the employer or client.

Code.title: Code
Code.description: Short unique code for this account.

AccountCreate.title: AccountCreate
AccountCreate.description:
Used when creating a new Account record.

Only Name and Code are accepted from the client.
IsActive / IsDeleted are server-managed and are not part of the input.

Locale.title: Locale
Locale.description: Locale for this template, e.g. 'en-AU'. Optional.

LevelOverride.title: Leveloverride
LevelOverride.description: Optional override for message Level: INFO, WARN, ERROR.

TemplateText.title: Templatetext
TemplateText.description: Text to display for this message code for this account.

Locale.title: Locale
Locale.description: Locale for this template, e.g. 'en-AU'. Optional.

LevelOverride.title: Leveloverride
LevelOverride.description: Optional override for message Level: INFO, WARN, ERROR.

TemplateText.title: Templatetext
TemplateText.description: Text to display for this message code for this account.

Name.title: Name
Name.description: Full display name of the employer or client.

Code.title: Code
Code.description: Short unique code for this account.

AccountRead.title: AccountRead
AccountRead.description:
Schema returned when reading Account data.

Includes server-managed fields such as AccountId, CreatedAt and ModifiedOn,
and exposes IsActive for display purposes only.

AccountUpdate.title: AccountUpdate
AccountUpdate.description:
Used when updating an existing Account record (partial).

Only Name and Code can be changed via this endpoint.
IsActive / IsDeleted remain server-managed.

HoursSource.title: Hourssource
HoursSource.description: Where to source ordinary hours from for accrual

SupportsLeaveCategoryFilters.title: Supportsleavecategoryfilters
SupportsLeaveCategoryFilters.description: Supports include/exclude of leave categories in accrual base

SupportsStandDownCategory.title: Supportsstanddowncategory
SupportsStandDownCategory.description: Supports accrual decisions for stand-down periods

SupportsJurisdictionOverrides.title: Supportsjurisdictionoverrides
SupportsJurisdictionOverrides.description: Allows jurisdiction-specific overrides (e.g. state WC rules)

AuditModeFlag.title: Auditmodeflag
AuditModeFlag.description: When True, policy is used in audit / what-if mode, not production posting

AccrualPolicyCreate.title: AccrualPolicyCreate
AccrualPolicyCreate.description: Used when creating new AccrualPolicy records.

AccrualPolicyUpdate.title: AccrualPolicyUpdate
AccrualPolicyUpdate.description: Used when updating AccrualPolicy records (all fields optional).

EmploymentTypeCreate.title: EmploymentTypeCreate
EmploymentTypeCreate.description: Used when creating a new EmploymentType record.

EmploymentTypeDetail.title: EmploymentTypeDetail
EmploymentTypeDetail.description: For now, list and detail share the same shape.

EmploymentTypeUpdate.title: EmploymentTypeUpdate
EmploymentTypeUpdate.description: Used when updating an existing EmploymentType record (partial).

FirstDayMode.title: Firstdaymode
FirstDayMode.description: Optional partial-day mode for the first day: FULL_DAY, HALF_DAY, or SPECIFIED_MINUTES.

LastDayMode.title: Lastdaymode
LastDayMode.description: Optional partial-day mode for the last day: FULL_DAY, HALF_DAY, or SPECIFIED_MINUTES.

RequestType.title: Requesttype
RequestType.description: High-level request intent; defaults to NORMAL.

BasisType.title: Basistype
BasisType.description: Optional hint for basis calculation. BASE_HOURS = derive day length from appointment; ROSTER = use rostered hours; MANUAL_HOURS = interpret StartTime/EndTime or custom minutes.

IsHalfPayFlag.title: Ishalfpayflag
IsHalfPayFlag.description: True if this request is for annual leave at half pay.

IsAdvanceLeaveFlag.title: Isadvanceleaveflag
IsAdvanceLeaveFlag.description: True if this request is for annual leave in advance (may go negative).

SignedAgreementRef.title: Signedagreementref
SignedAgreementRef.description: Reference to written agreement for advance or cash-out, if required.

EvidenceComment.title: Evidencecomment
EvidenceComment.description: Free-text explanation or notes supporting the leave request.
EvidenceComment.example: Child admitted to hospital on 26/11; GP certificate to follow.

HasAttachmentEvidence.title: Hasattachmentevidence
HasAttachmentEvidence.description: True if at least one supporting document has been attached or sighted.

EvidenceExternalRef.title: Evidenceexternalref
EvidenceExternalRef.description: Optional external reference for evidence (claim/case ID, file reference, etc.).

EvidenceOverrideReason.title: Evidenceoverridereason
EvidenceOverrideReason.description: Approver's reason when approving without required evidence (SOFT mode).
EvidenceOverrideReason.example: Spoke with employee; certificate delayed but circumstances verified.

CashoutOverrideReason.title: Cashoutoverridereason
CashoutOverrideReason.description: Approver's reason when overriding cashout caps in SOFT mode.
CashoutOverrideReason.example: Exceptional case â€“ exiting employee; cashout cap overridden.

IsDirectedFlag.title: Isdirectedflag
IsDirectedFlag.description: True if leave is being taken under a direction (shutdown/excess leave).

Status.title: Status
Status.description: Target status: DRAFT | SUBMITTED | APPROVED | REJECTED

IdempotencyKey.title: Idempotencykey
IdempotencyKey.description: Required when Status='SUBMITTED'; used for duplicate protection.

AccrualIncludeLeaveTypes.title: Accrualincludeleavetypes
AccrualIncludeLeaveTypes.description: JSON/list of leave categories that DO accrue AL

AccrualExcludeLeaveTypes.title: Accrualexcludeleavetypes
AccrualExcludeLeaveTypes.description: JSON/list of leave categories that do NOT accrue AL

ConversionRules.title: Conversionrules
ConversionRules.description: JSON describing allowed conversions and conditions

EvidenceRequirementMode.title: Evidencerequirementmode
EvidenceRequirementMode.description: Evidence requirement strength: NONE, SOFT, or STRICT.

EvidenceContentMode.title: Evidencecontentmode
EvidenceContentMode.description: What counts as evidence: ANY, COMMENT_OR_ATTACHMENT, ATTACHMENT_ONLY, or COMMENT_ONLY.

CashoutLimitMode.title: Cashoutlimitmode
CashoutLimitMode.description: How strictly to enforce cashout caps: STRICT or SOFT (allow override with reason).

LeaveTypeRuleCreate.title: LeaveTypeRuleCreate
LeaveTypeRuleCreate.description: Used when creating a new LeaveTypeRule record.

LeaveTypeRuleDetail.title: LeaveTypeRuleDetail
LeaveTypeRuleDetail.description: Same shape for list & detail for now.

LeaveTypeRuleUpdate.title: LeaveTypeRuleUpdate
LeaveTypeRuleUpdate.description: Used when updating an existing LeaveTypeRule record (partial).

PositionCreate.title: PositionCreate
PositionCreate.description: Used when creating a new Position record.

PositionGroupCreate.title: PositionGroupCreate
PositionGroupCreate.description: Used when creating a new PositionGroup record.

PositionGroupUpdate.title: PositionGroupUpdate
PositionGroupUpdate.description: Used when updating an existing PositionGroup record (partial).

PositionUpdate.title: PositionUpdate
PositionUpdate.description: Used when updating an existing Position record.

PostRequest.title: PostRequest
PostRequest.description:
Minimal payload to post preview rows.
Use the same inputs as preview (appointment-first) + SourceRef to ensure idempotency.

Days.title: Days
Days.description: Length of the processing period in days

StartDate.title: Startdate
StartDate.description: Anchor start date for period generation

ProcessPeriodGroupCreate.title: ProcessPeriodGroupCreate
ProcessPeriodGroupCreate.description: Used when creating new ProcessPeriodGroup records.

ProcessPeriodGroupUpdate.title: ProcessPeriodGroupUpdate
ProcessPeriodGroupUpdate.description: Used when updating existing ProcessPeriodGroup records (partial).
